page.title: 18LYME REGIS LIFE BOAT
page.content: There has been an Atlantic 21 lifeboat at Lyme Regis since 1967. It's maximum speed is 30 knots, width 7'6" and length 22'9". It cost about Â£25,000 and has a radius of action of 50 miles. It is kept on a trolley in the Lifeboat house at the Cobb. On average it is called out about twice a week during the summer season and once a fortnight in winter.It is called into action when the coastguards receive a 999 call and then two maroons are fired. The coxwain is John Hodder, and Paul Wason is a senior helmsman (he has been on the crew 9 years). The boat is crewed by 3 men (or 4 at night) and there are 14 volunteers at Lyme Regis to call upon.
